definitions.definition: the whole physical structure of a human or an animal

examples.text: **The human body** is a complex structure.
a male/female/naked body
The virus can affect all **parts of the body**.
The heart pumps blood around the body.
His **whole body** was trembling.
**body fat/weight/temperature/size**
Yoga is designed to release the **body and mind** from tension.
Extreme heat may cause changes in the body.
Pain racked her body.
to maintain your ideal body weight

definitions.definition: the main part of a body not including the head, or not including the head, arms and legs

examples.text: She had injuries to her head and body.
He has a large body, but thin legs.
These exercises help develop your **upper body**.
In golf, the position of the legs, body, arms, hands and head is totally responsible for the success of the forward swing.
He pulled the sheet up over his naked body.

definitions.definition: the body of a dead person or animal

examples.text: a **dead body**
The family of the missing girl has been called in by the police to identify the body.
A man's **body was found** floating in the river.
His body is being brought back to his home town for burial.

definitions.definition: the main part of something, especially a building, a vehicle or a book, an article, etc.

examples.text: the body of a plane *(= the central part where the seats are)*
the **main body** of the text
The bar is in the main body of the hotel.
Although parts were scattered over the surrounding fields, the main body of the plane had landed in one piece.
Most of the body panels on a Land Rover are aluminium.
The new car body weighed 9.55 tonnes.
There are some references in the main body of the text.

definitions.definition: a group of people who work or act together, often for an official purpose, or who are connected in some other way

examples.text: a regulatory/an advisory body
The **governing body** of the school is/are concerned about discipline.
recognized **professional bodies** such as the Law Association
An **independent body** has been set up to investigate the affair.
A large body of people will be affected by the tax cuts.
The protesters marched in a body *(= all together)* to the White House.
An independent body has been set up to regulate the telecommunications sector.
The government is consulting trade unions and other professional bodies.
They asked for funds from Gymnastics USA, the sport's governing body.
The students marched in a body to the government offices.

definitions.definition: a large amount or collection of something

examples.text: a vast **body of evidence/information/research**
large bodies of water *(= lakes or seas)*
There is a powerful body of opinion against the ruling.
The two islands are separated by a large body of water.
a large body of evidence
**heavenly bodies** *(= stars, planets, etc.)*
an operation to remove a **foreign body** *(= something that would not usually be there)* from a wound
They removed a foreign body from her eye.
Stars are celestial bodies.
He underwent an operation to remove a foreign body from the wound.
Astrology extends back to the time when people worshipped the heavenly bodies as gods.

definitions.definition: the full strong taste of alcoholic drinks or the thick healthy quality of somebody’s hair

examples.text: a wine with plenty of body
Regular use of conditioner is supposed to give your hair more body.

definitions.definition: having the type of body mentioned

examples.text: full-bodied red wines
soft-bodied insects

definitions.definition: a piece of clothing that fits tightly over the upper body and bottom, usually fastening between the legs

examples.text: She committed herself body and soul to fighting for the cause.

definitions.definition: to stay alive with just enough of the food, clothing, etc. that you need

examples.text: They barely have enough money to keep body and soul together.

definitions.definition: to have none of the quality mentioned

examples.text: She was honest and hard-working, and didn't have an unkind bone in her body.

definitions.definition: used to show you are strongly opposed to something

examples.text: She moves into our home over my dead body.

definitions.definition: to have sex with somebody in exchange for money

wordOrigin: Old English bodig, of unknown origin.
